w.lemma: emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V

dates, 1 pānu 4 sūtu, at the end of the month, 1 pānu 4 sūtu [...]

it stood 1 cubit behind Saturn to the east. The 6th, ... [...]

[Saturn’s] last appearance in the west in Scorpius; I did not watch. Night of the 28th, last part of the night, [... That month,]
the equivalent [for 1 shekel of silver] was: barley, 1 pānu; dates, 1 pānu 5 sūtu, at the end of the month, 1 pānu 3 sūtu; mustard, [...]
Month VIII, on (the 1st which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month), the moon’s first appearance; sunset to moonset: 13° 30'.; the moon was in front of Mercury [...]

The 12th, clouds were in the sky. Night of the 13th (and) the 13th, clouds were in the sky. Ni[ght ... lunar eclipse ...]
when it began, after 21° night all of it was eclipsed. 20° night [...]
α Librae was eclipsed. In its eclipse, there was lightning, thunder, rain [...]
1 cubit [...] of α Geminorum. Around the 18th, when Jupiter became stationary in the east [... Night of the 22nd,]
